content: Created `docs/e2e/README_e2e_sections/_template.md` as a concise authoring template that standardizes section structure, stable anchors, and cross-linking conventions for modular E2E README sections.

output.code: from pathlib import Path import json target_path = Path('/mnt/data').joinpath('docs/e2e/README_e2e_sections/_template.md') target_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) chunks = [ """# E2E README modular section template This file defines the standard structure and linking conventions for a modular section consumed by `docs/e2e/README_e2e.md`. Copy this file to a new section file (for example `30_running.md`) and edit the prose while keeping the heading levels and anchor conventions consistent.""", """## Conventions (keep consistent across all sections) ### File naming - Use a two-digit prefix to control ordering in the assembled README: `00_`, `10_`, `20_`, … - Use lowercase snake-case: `30_running.md`, `40_troubleshooting.md`. ### Heading levels - Each section file starts with a single level-1 heading (`#`). - Use level-2 headings (`##`) for subsections. - Use level-3 headings (`###`) for deeper detail only when needed. ### Anchors (stable link targets) - Prefer explicit HTML anchors for any heading that will be cross-linked. - Anchor format: `e2e--` using lowercase and hyphens. - Keep anchors stable even if you reword the visible heading. Example: ```md ## Running the suite ``` ### Cross-links - Link within a section using the explicit anchor: `[text](#e2e-running-suite)`. - Link to another section file using a relative file link plus anchor: - `[Configuration](./20_configuration.md#e2e-configuration-overview)` - When linking back to the assembled doc, use the relative path from this folder: - `[Back to README_e2e](../README_e2e.md) ### Code blocks and commands - Use fenced code blocks with a language tag where possible (`bash`, `yaml`, `json`). - Prefer copy/pasteable commands that are safe by default and clearly scoped to E2E.""" , """# Section title (short, descriptive) One or two paragraphs explaining: - what this section covers, - who it is for, - and where it sits in the E2E workflow. ## Quick links - [Back to README_e2e](../README_e2e.md) - [Prerequisites](./10_prerequisites.md) - [Configuration](./20_configuration.md) ## Scope Describe what is included and excluded. Use bullets for clarity. Included: - Item 1 - Item 2 Not included: - Item A - Item B ## Inputs and outputs Document the contract for this section. Inputs: - Config files (paths and formats) - Environment variables (names and meaning) - External services (if any) Outputs: - Logs (where to find them) - Artifacts (reports, snapshots) - Exit codes / failure modes ## Procedure Describe the recommended steps in order. Keep steps actionable. 1. Step one with a clear precondition. 2. Step two with expected result. 3. Step three with verification. Example command pattern: ```bash # Run from repository root python -m --help ``` ## Validation checklist A short list readers can use to confirm success. - Expected files exist in the output directory. - The run completes with a zero exit code. - A summary report is generated and readable. ## Troubleshooting List common issues, their likely causes, and fixes. - Symptom: … - Cause: … - Fix: … ## References Link to other local sections and any project-internal docs that clarify details. - Related: [Overview](./00_overview.md) - Related: [Prerequisites](./10_prerequisites.md) - Related: [Configuration](./20_configuration.md)""" ] final_text = '\n'.join(block.strip('\n') for block in chunks).strip() + '\n' target_path.write_text(final_text, encoding='utf-8') print('FILE_WRITTEN:docs/e2e/README_e2e_sections/_template.md') print('DIR_STATE:' + json.dumps(sorted(str(p.relative_to(Path("/mnt/data"))) for p in target_path.parent.glob('*') if p.is_file())))

content.text: Created `docs/e2e/README_e2e_sections/_template.md` as a concise authoring template that standardizes section structure, stable anchors, and cross-linking conventions for modular E2E README sections.
